name: Abrictosaurus
description: Abrictosaurus  The Abrictosaurus was a small herbivore at around 4 feet long.

name: Abrosaurus
description: Abrosaurus  The Abrosaurus is known from only one very well preserved skull.

name: Acrocanthosaurus
description: Acrocanthosaurus The longest known Acrocanthusaurus to be found was 11.5 meters in length.

name: Allosaurus
description: Allosaurus  There has been over 20 different Allosaurus fossil finding and many are in very good shape.

name: Anchisaurus
description: Anchisaurus  The Anchisaurus was one of the first dinosaurs discovered in North America.

name: Archaeopteryx
description: Archaeopteryx Archaeopteryx is the earliest and most primitive bird known.

name: Barosaurus
description: Barosaurus  Barosaurus have been found in the Morrison Formation. In the same location there was also findings of Diplodocus, Apatosaurus, Camarasaurus, Brachiosaurus, Haplocanthosaurus, Allosaurus

name: Brachiosaurus
description: Brachiosaurus Brachiosaurus were so big that they are thought to have two hearts to be able to pump blood way up their necks.

name: Brachytrachelopan
description: Brachytrachelopan There is only one known Brachytrachelopan fossil finding which was discovered in Argentina, South America.

name: Brontosaurus
description: Brontosaurus Brontosaurus was first discovered in 1879 by Othniel Charles Marsh.

name: Camarasaurus
description: Camarasaurus  The Camarasaurus measured to roughly 48ft in length and 15ft in height.

name: Camptosaurus
description: Camptosaurus Camptosaurus was first described by O.C marsh in 1879, but called the dinosaur a Camptonotus. The name was changed to Camptosaurus in 1885 because the first name was taken for an insect.

name: Ceratosaurus
description: Ceratosaurus  The Ceratosaurus was about twelve feet high and over thirty feet long.

name: Coelurus
description: Coelurus  Coelophysis was three meters long and it had only three functional digits, the fourth embedded in the flesh of the hand.

name: Compsognathus
description: Compsognathus  In 1901 10 egg fossils were found that were thought to belong to the Compsognathus species. It wasn't until 1993 that researchers determined that they were most likely from a Sinosauropteryx.

name: Dilophosaurus
description: Dilophosaurus Dilophosaurus is probably the dinosaur that most commonly is mistaken for certain features of it due to Jurassic Park.

name: Diplodocus
description: Diplodocus  The Diplodocus was one of the largest dinosaurs ever to be discovered. Its average size was 88ft in length.

name: Europasaurus
description: Europasaurus  It has been suggested that the ancestor of Europasaurus would have dwarfed rapidly after immigrating to a paleo-island because of lack of food.

name: Fruitadens
description: Fruitadens  The Fruitadens is the smallest known dinosaur of the Ornithischian group to exist today.

name: Giraffatitan
description: Giraffatitan  The Giraffatitan is also known as the Brachiosaurus which means "arm lizard", from the Greek brachion ("arm") and sauros ("lizard").

name: Guanlong
description: Guanlong  the wording "Guanlong" means Crowned Dragon because of the two crests on its head.

name: Haplocanthosaurus
description: Haplocanthosaurus There has never been a skull fossil of a Haplocanthosaurus ever discovered. The descreption of the dinosaur was based by the body parts that were found.

name: Heterodontosaurus
description: Heterodontosaurus Heterodontosaurus fossils have been found in Africa.

name: Huayangosaurus
description: Huayangosaurus  The Huayangosaurus was one of the earlier plated dinosaurs which was very primitive with a broad skull and teeth in the front of its mouth.

name: Juravenator
description: Juravenator  The Juravenator means Jura Mountains hunter in Greek.

name: Kentrosaurus
description: Kentrosaurus  The Kentrosaurus used its spines on its back to regulate its body temperature.

name: Laosaurus
description: Laosaurus  The Laosaurus was first described by O.C. Marsh in 1878.

name: Lesothosaurus
description: Lesothosaurus  The Lesothosaurus is one of the most early ornithischians (bird-hipped dinosaur).

name: Lexovisaurus
description: Lexovisaurus  The Lexovisaurus was a dinosaur specie that was much like a Stegosaurus. It has round pointed spines like a Stegosaurus.

name: Limusaurus
description: Limusaurus  The Limusaurus is a great example to show that its possible that dinosaurs did not evolve into birds.

name: Massospondylus
description:
Massospondylus 
Most of the Massospondylus fossils were discovered in the Country of Africa in Namibia, Zimbabwe and South Africa.

name: Megalosaurus
description: Megalosaurus  The first Megalosaurus fossil was discovered in 1676 in England.

name: Miragaia longicollum
description: Miragaia longicollum The Miragaia Longicollum was named this just recently.

name: Monolophosaurus
description: Monolophosaurus Before the Monolophosaurus got its name the news press though that it was a Jiangjunmiaosaurus.

name: Nanosaurus
description: Nanosaurus Nanosaurus actually means "dwarf Lizard" and was described in 1877 but their is minimal information about this dinosaur because there has not been many finding.

name: Omeisaurus
description: Omeisaurus Omeisaurus was found in the China region. It had unusual features than other in its group such as nostrils located close to the end of its nose.

name: Scutellosaurus
description: Scutellosaurus Scutellosaurus was a herbivore that was found in Arizona. Only two partial fossil body structures have been found.

name: Segisaurus
description: Segisaurus  The Segisaurus is known from only a few partial fossils discovered. It was closely related to the Procompsognathus.

name: Stegosaurus
description: Stegosaurus  The Stegosaurus Head fossil size was very small. There was also a large open area inside the region of the spinal cord. Some scientists believe that they had a second brain that shared responsibilities and functions of the brain.

name: Supersaurus
description: Supersaurus  A almost complete Fossil of the Supersaurus has been found and was nicknamed "Jimbo". It currently is located at the Wyoming Dinosaur Center.

name: Zigongosaurus
description: Zigongosaurus  The Zigongosaurus was named by Hou, Chao, and Chu in 1976.
